title: Kiss, Marry, Kill: Game Instructions & Sample Questions

steps.title: Take turns coming up with three names.
steps.content: Take turns coming up with three names. They can be any three names, from fictional characters to celebrities! Pick someone to start; that person must be the first to think of three names. As you play, you can go around the group and give everyone a chance to do this. [1] X Research source There’s also no player limit. You can play Kiss Marry Kill with as few as two people or as many people as you like.

steps.title: Ask another player "Kiss, Marry, Kill" followed by the chosen names.
steps.content: Ask another player "Kiss, Marry, Kill" followed by the chosen names. Whoever comes up with the three names must pick another player and ask the question phrased above. You can let players pick who they ask randomly, or just have the first player pick (and then whichever player gets picked can be the next to think of three names).

steps.title: That player must decide who they'd rather kiss, marry, or kill.
steps.content: That player must decide who they'd rather kiss, marry, or kill. When a player is asked a "Kiss, Marry, Kill...?" question, they can think over the options before telling everyone else (out loud) which one they’d kiss, which one they’d marry, and which one they’d kill (out of the options given). [2] X Research source For example, say someone asks you, "Kiss, Marry, Kill...Spiderman, Deadpool, and the Scarlet Witch?" You might answer, "Kiss the Scarlet Witch, marry Spiderman, and kill Deadpool." Keep going from player to player so everyone has a chance to think of names and answer questions! There aren’t any winners or losers in this game; it's just the fun of finding out how you and your friends really feel about different characters (or real-life people).

steps.title: Celebrities
steps.content: Celebrities As mentioned above, you could name a few of your favorite (or least favorite) celebrities and force people to choose who they’d kiss, marry, and kill. If you’re not sure where to start, you could also try to come up with a more specific category for each of the names. For example, Kiss, Marry, Kill… [3] X Research source Comedians: Adam Sandler, Tiffany Haddish, and Eddie Murphy Actors : Keanu Reeves, Glen Powell, and Idris Elba Actresses : Sydney Sweeney, Eiza González, and Anne Hathaway Social media stars : Charli D’Amelio, Zach King, and Addison Rae Battle of the Chrises : Chris Pine, Chris Hemsworth, and Chris Evans Charlie’s Angels: Farrah Fawcett, Lucy Liu, and Kristen Stewart Marvel actors: Paul Bettany, Anthony Mackie, and Brie Larson DC actors : Henry Cavill, Margot Robbie and Ben Affleck

steps.title: TV and movie characters
steps.content: TV and movie characters When in doubt, there are too many fictional characters to count—which means you’ll never run out of names to use! Think of the shows and movies your fellow players love most and pull from those as you play. For example, Kiss, Marry, Kill… [4] X Research source Romantic comedy leads : Elle Woods, Carrie Bradshaw, and Peter Kavinsky Secret agents : James Bond, Natasha Romanoff, and Jack Ryan Intrepid adventurers : Indiana Jones, Lara Croft, and Rick O’Connell Wizards : Gandalf, Doctor Strange, and Howl Witches : Hermione Granger, Agatha Harkness, and Elphaba Thropp Vampires : Edward Cullen, Lestat de Lioncourt, and Spike Werewolves : Jacob Black, Derek Hale, and Remus Lupin Zombie-slayers : Rick Grimes, Jill Valentine, and Tallahassee Princes and princesses : Cinderella, Prince Adam (The Beast), and Ariel (The Little Mermaid) Space explorers : Ellen Ripley, James Kirk, and Han Solo Pirates : Jack Sparrow, Elizabeth Swann, and Captain Hook Superheroes : Superman, Wonder Woman, and Iron Man Villains : Thanos, Hans Gruber, and the Joker Detectives : Monk, Benoit Blanc, and Veronica Mars Cartoon characters : Bugs Bunny, Patrick Star, and Velma Dinkley Pixar icons : Buzz Lightyear, Elastigirl (Helen Parr), and Mike Wazowski

steps.title: Book characters
steps.content: Book characters Shows and movies aren’t the only places to look for Kiss Marry Kill ideas—there’s also literature! Consider the books you and your fellow players have read, and which characters the group would most likely recognize (and have fun with). For example, Kiss, Marry, Kill… Famous protagonists : Katniss Everdeen, Harry Potter, and Percy Jackson Infamous antagonists : Voldemort, Count Dracula, and Captain Hook Lovable mentors : Dumbledore, Kelsier, and Haymitch Abernathy Antiheroes : Dorian Gray, the Phantom of the Opera, and Severus Snape Fantasy icons : Daenerys Targaryen, Bilbo Baggins, and Locke Lamora Characters from classic literature : Elizabeth Bennet, Sherlock Holmes, and Ebenezer Scrooge Tragic characters : Othello, Frankenstein’s monster, and Heathcliff Dr. Seuss characters : The Cat in the Hat, Horton, and the Lorax Shakespeare characters : Viola (Twelfth Night), Iago (Othello), or Lady Macbeth (Macbeth)

steps.title: Musicians
steps.content: Musicians Everyone has their own musical tastes, and musicians they admire (or don’t), which makes this a rich topic for Kiss Marry Kill! You could name some of today’s most popular musicians or go for more nostalgic figures who rose to fame in decades past. For example, Kiss, Marry, Kill… Boy bands : *NSYNC, The Backstreet Boys, and One Direction Girl bands : The Spice Girls, Destiny’s Child, and the Pussycat Dolls K-pop stars: Jungkook, Jisoo, and Hyunjin Pop stars : Taylor Swift, Rihanna, and Adele Rockstars : David Bowie, Freddie Mercury, and Stevie Nicks Country musicians : Dolly Parton, Keith Urban, and Johnny Cash Rappers : Kendrick Lamar, Eminem, and Megan Thee Stallion

steps.title: Other fictional characters and figures
steps.content: Other fictional characters and figures You don’t have to limit yourself to characters from TV, movies, and books. Get creative! You can branch out into any subject matter, from video games and comics to fairy tales and even characters associated with holidays. For example, Kiss, Marry, Kill… Video game characters : Mario, Samus Aran, and Tom Nook Comic book characters : Batman, John Constantine, and Wolverine Famous fairies : Tinker Bell, The Sugar Plum Fairy, and the Fairy Godmother Fairy tale characters : Rapunzel, Robin Hood, and The Big Bad Wolf Cereal mascots : Tony the Tiger, Cap’n Crunch, and Lucky the Leprechaun Holiday figures : Santa Claus, the Easter Bunny, and the Tooth Fairy

steps.title: Public figures
steps.content: Public figures Public figures could include politicians, presidents, social media influencers—anyone with a public presence and widespread recognition. Of course, they should also be people your fellow players can recognize! For example, Kiss, Marry, Kill… Politicians: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Bernie Sanders, and Barack Obama Past Presidents: George Washington, Richard Nixon, and Theodore Roosevelt Famous chefs: Gordon Ramsay, Rachael Ray, and Guy Fieri Influencers: Kylie Jenner, Khaby Lame, and Selena Gomez

steps.title: Historical figures
steps.content: Historical figures Think about the important and famous historical figures you and your friends have all heard about, from ancient Greek philosophers to the many kings, queens, and rulers throughout history. Are there any you could use in a game of Kiss Marry Kill? Odds are, the answer is yes! For example, Kiss, Marry, Kill… Royalty and rulers: Alexander the Great, Cleopatra, and Charlemagne Philosophers: Socrates, Aristotle, and Hypatia Authors: Jane Austen, Oscar Wilde, and Charles Dickens Artists: Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Rembrandt Adventurers: Marco Polo, Amelia Earhart, and Francis Drake Inventors: Benjamin Franklin, Hedy Lamarr, and Nikola Tesla Poets: Emily Dickinson, Edgar Allan Poe, and William Shakespeare

steps.title: Athletes
steps.content: Athletes Are you and your friends sports fans? Try basing a round or two of Kiss Marry Kill on sports and athletes you follow. Just make sure everyone else in the group will know the names, too! For example, Kiss, Marry, Kill… Football players: Travis Kelce, Josh Allen, and Aaron Rodgers Soccer players: Lionel Messi, Cristiano Ronaldo, and Marta Basketball players: LeBron James, Stephen Curry, and Caitlin Clark Baseball players: Mookie Betts, Shohei Ohtani, and Aaron Judge Tennis players: Serena Williams, Maria Sharapova, and Rafael Nadal Wrestlers: John Cena, Becky Lynch, and CM Punk

steps.title: Friends
steps.content: Friends You don’t always have to name famous people or iconic characters. You can also use names a little closer to home. If the group is comfortable with it, pull names from the people you’re all friends with (and even from your fellow players). And if you need inspiration, just open up your school yearbooks for ideas!

steps.title: Play the game via text or chat.
steps.content: Play the game via text or chat. If you can’t meet up in person but still want to play a game with friends, you can do it with a phone (or mobile device). Follow the same rules virtually: have one person send a “Kiss, Marry, Kill…” prompt, and pick another person to answer it. You can set up a specific order of players to go in or have everyone answer each prompt! You can also play Kiss Marry Kill using different apps (like this celebrity-themed KMK app ) or online games (like the Kiss Marry Kill game ). And, if you need more help coming up with questions, you can find plenty of Kiss Marry Kill generators online. For example, this generator will choose a category for you, and this generator will randomly select celebrities. Want to play Kiss Marry Kill solo? Take our Kiss Marry Kill quiz !

steps.title: Change “Kiss, Marry, Kill” to something else.
steps.content: Change “Kiss, Marry, Kill” to something else. If “Kiss, Marry, Kill” feels a little too extreme, there are other versions of the game that work the same way but have different wording. And, depending on your preferences, there are plenty of options! For example: [5] X Research source Kiss, Marry, Ghost. In this version, you’re choosing who you’d “ghost” (stop texting, calling, and speaking to) instead of kill. Hug, Roast, Block. Decide which person you’d hug, which one you’d roast (jokingly insult), and which one you’d block (from your contacts on your phone, for example). Kiss, Marry, Prank. This is another, more lighthearted version of the game where you’re choosing someone to prank instead of kill. Karaoke, Vacation, Unfollow . In this version, decide who you’d sing a karaoke duet with, who you’d go on vacation with, and who you’d unfollow on social media. Borrow, Steal, Destroy. Instead of people, this version of the game deals with items. What would you borrow, what would you steal, and what would you destroy? Date, Dump, Friendzone. Decide who you’d want to date, who you’d inevitably end up dumping, and who you’d remain forever friends (but nothing more) with. Hire, Fire, Promote. For a workplace-themed game, decide who you’d hire as an employee, who you’d end up firing, and who would earn a promotion.
